14 #call uarm_move service

29 
30 class uArm_Remote_Client():
31 
32  def __init__(self,ns):
33 
34  self.name = ns
35 
36  #create ROS action client:
37  #self.CLIENT-NAME = actionlib.SimpleActionClient(TOPIC NAME, TYPE OF MESSAGE)
38  self.client = actionlib.SimpleActionClient(str(self.name+'uarm_move'), uarm_msgs.msg.uarm_moveAction)
39  self.ranges = '''
40 #################################
41 # #
42 # valid positions #
43 # #
44 # x element [30, 280] #
45 # #
46 # y element [-280, 280] #
47 # #
48 # z element [0, 130] #
49 # #
50 # RADIUS in x-y Ebene > 150 #
51 # #
52 #################################'''
53  print(self.ranges)
54 
55  def move_client(self, x, y, z):
56 
57  print("connecting")
58  # Waits until the action server has started up and started
59  # listening for goals.
60  self.client.wait_for_server()
61  print("connected")
62 
63  # Creates a goal to send to the action server.
64  goal = uarm_msgs.msg.uarm_moveGoal(x=x,y=y,z=z)
65  print("goal defined")
66 
67  # Sends the goal to the action server.
68  self.client.send_goal(goal)
69  print("goal sent")
70 
71  # Waits for the server to finish performing the action.
72  self.client.wait_for_result()
73 
74  # Prints out the result of executing the action
75  return self.client.get_result()
76 
77 
78  def move(self):
79  print("select coordinates of target position")
80  try:
81  x = int(input("x: "))
82  y = int(input("y: "))
83  z = int(input("z: "))
84  return self.move_client(x, y, z)
85  except:
86  return False
87 
88 if __name__ == "__main__":
89 
90  #start node
91  rospy.init_node('uarm_client', anonymous=True)
92 
93  #look for namespace in case of start with launchfile
94  try:
95  ns = rospy.get_param('~ns_client')
96  except:
97  ns = "uarm1/"
98 
99  #create controller object
100  remote = uArm_Remote_Client(ns)
101 
102  #call move function and print result
103  print(remote.move())
